decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful planeswalkers and efficient spells, while also utilizing a small creature package to apply pressure when needed. By leveraging cards like Dack Fayden, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind opponents over the course of the game. With a suite of powerful blue cantrips and counterspells, alongside key disruptive elements like Lightning Bolt and Pyroblast, the goal is to disrupt opponents' game plans while developing a strong board presence of its own.

The key concept of this deck is to use powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also having access to powerful card advantage and mana acceleration to establish control of the game. The deck aims to use cards like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Spell Pierce to counter key spells, while also using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dark Confidant for card advantage. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Tinker allows for explosive plays, while the land base provides strong mana fixing and utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win the game.

This deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Glowrider, along with hate cards such as Leonin Arbiter and Spirit of the Labyrinth, to slow down the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thought-Knot Seer to apply pressure and provide card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure a consistent mana curve. The overall strategy is to aggressively disrupt the opponent while deploying threats to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this Vintage Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam to create an overwhelming board presence. By using cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent with a strong graveyard-based strategy. The deck also includes cards like Creeping Chill and Noxious Revival to maximize the potential of the graveyard and maintain consistency in its combo game plan.

This deck focuses on using a combination of countermagic, card advantage, and removal spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful card drawing engines like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, along with efficient threats like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Oko, Thief of Crowns. Additionally, it utilizes mana acceleration with Moxen and Tolarian Academy to cast game-breaking spells like Yawgmoth's Will and Tinker. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient use of its resources and disruptive elements while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and controlling the game using a combination of powerful spells and efficient creatures. It aims to generate card advantage through card draw and tutoring effects, while also utilizing counterspells and removal to control the board. The deck has a strong mana base with a mix of lands and mana-producing artifacts to ensure it can cast its spells quickly and efficiently. Overall, the deck is designed to outlast the opponent and win through a combination of attrition and powerful finishers like Tendrils of Agony or Bolas's Citadel.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly assemble a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. Key cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder help fill the graveyard, while creatures like Hollow One and Hogaak can be cast for cheap or free. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its game plan. By efficiently utilizing the graveyard and presenting a fast clock, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while building up a board presence with aggressive creatures. It includes cards that protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's spells, as well as mana acceleration to play threats faster. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the game by using disruptive creatures, mana denial with cards like Wasteland, and powerful creatures like Thalia and Champion of the Parish. Overall, the deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, disruptive aggro game plan.

The deck focuses on using disruptive and powerful creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Tarmogoyf to control the board while using cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to provide additional card advantage and threats. The deck utilizes a combination of card draw, removal, and proactive threats to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy, creating a versatile and powerful midrange deck.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly by playing powerful artifact creatures and disrupting their mana base with tax effects and land destruction. It leverages the synergy between artifacts like Arcbound Ravager and Phyrexian Revoker to control the board while using efficient threats like Walking Ballista and Fleetwheel Cruiser to apply pressure. By using Mishra's Workshop to ramp out threats early and disrupt opponents with cards like Sphere of Resistance, Thorn of Amethyst, and Trinisphere, this deck aims to win through aggressive plays and resource denial.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro MUD deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while rapidly deploying powerful threats. The deck utilizes cards like Phyrexian Revoker, Sorcerous Spyglass, and Sphere of Resistance to disrupt the opponent's plans, while quickly ramping into threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland are included to control the opponent's mana base, ensuring they are unable to mount a successful defense. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its disruptive elements and powerful threats.

The deck revolves around the combo of using Doomsday to stack the top of the library with Thassa's Oracle and winning the game on the spot. It includes various cantrips and tutors to find the combo pieces quickly, as well as counterspells and disruptive cards to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game as fast and efficiently as possible, utilizing powerful Vintage cards such as Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and the Moxen to generate mana and draw cards.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting opponents' plans with counterspells and removal. It utilizes efficient card draw and selection to maintain a steady stream of resources while using powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain a tempo advantage. By combining the prowess of aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor with disruptive elements like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the game and pressure opponents into making mistakes. The inclusion of powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and Black Lotus enables explosive plays and a consistent mana base for casting spells.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo card Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, creating a loop of powerful spells and ultimately overwhelming the opponent. The deck includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells and hand disruption, alongside powerful combo pieces like Tinker and Bolas's Citadel. The goal is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently, using cards like Oath of Druids to find key pieces and accelerate the game plan. The deck aims to quickly win the game through a devastating combination of spells and interactions.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. The deck utilizes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy to control the game, while also playing powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. By combining disruption, aggressive threats, and card advantage, this deck aims to out tempo and out value the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board while setting up powerful combo plays using Oath of Druids to cheat out big creatures like Blightsteel Colossus and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It utilizes card advantage spells and counterspells to maintain control of the game, with the ability to quickly ramp into game-winning plays through Channel and Tinker. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Dack Fayden and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its game plan.
